intro: Borreria distans, commonly known as the Mexican broom, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils and along coastal areas. Borreria distans is also known for its use in traditional medicine by indigenous communities.
